original: Erlandson, Per Adolf, fd. överste, Växjö, f. 3/2/77 i Skara av artisten Olof E. o. Selma Lundgren. G. 1. 03 m. Victioiriia Bifcallil, ’d. 40; 2. 44-47 m. recitatrisen Ragna Ljungdeill. Barn,: Ingrid Maria f. 04, d. 46, Per Gösta 08, d. 19, Per Rolf 10. — Stud:ex. i Skara 95, off:ex. 97, Gci 99-00, KHS 04-06, SS 03, 17 o. 23 m. fl. kurser. Und:löjtn. v. Västgöta reg. 97, löjtn. 99, kapt. 11, major i armén 20, v. Älvsb. reg. s. å., öv:löjtn. i armén 25, tf. öv:löjtn. v. Bohusl. reg. s. å., öv:-löjtn. där 26, överste i armén o. tf. chef f. Västerb. reg. 28, överste o. chef där s. å., chef f. Kronob. reg. 32-37. Reg:kvartermäst. 07-12, adjut. o. bitr. lär. v. takt. utbildn :kurs f. kapt. (ryttmäst.) 09 o. 10, förste adjut. v. III. arméfördeln. stab 13-16 o. 18-20, chef f. inf .-skolor å Karl-sborg 24-27 m. fl. kommend. Led. av arméns fullm. 18 o. 35-37. KSOlkl, LandstrGM, Blek. landst:förb. GM. Kronob. land-st :förb. GM, Västerb. landst:förb. GM, SkytteM, FGftjk, Skyttem. i guld.
translated: Erlandson, Per Adolf, former colonel, born on February 3rd, 1877 in Skara to the artist Olof E. and Selma Lundgren. Married 1st to Victioiriia Bifcallil in 1903, widowed in 1940; 2nd to recitationist Ragna Ljungdeill from 1944-1947. Children: Ingrid Maria born in 1904, deceased in 1946; Per Gösta born in 1908, deceased in 1919; Per Rolf born in 1910. Education: graduated from Skara in 1895, Officer Candidate School in 1897, General Course in 1899-1900, Krigshögskolan (War College) in 1904-1906, Staff College in 1903, and attended other courses in 1917 and 1923. Military career: Second lieutenant in the Västgöta regiment in 1897, lieutenant in 1899, captain in 1911, major in the army in 1920, vice commander of the Älvsborg regiment the same year, lieutenant colonel in the army in 1925, acting lieutenant colonel in the Bohuslän regiment the same year, lieutenant colonel there in 1926, colonel in the army, and acting chief of the Västerbotten regiment in 1928, colonel and chief there the same year, chief of the Kronoberg regiment from 1932-1937. Other positions held: regimental quartermaster in 1907-1912, adjutant and assistant instructor in tactical training course for captains (cavalry captains) in 1909 and 1910, first adjutant at the III. Army Division staff from 1913-1916 and 1918-1920, chief of infantry schools at Karlsborg from 1924-1927 and several other commands. Member of the Army's plenipotentiary in 1918 and 1935-1937. KSOlkl, LandstrGM, Blek. landst:förb. GM. Kronob. land-st :förb. GM, Västerb. landst:förb. GM, SkytteM, FGftjk, Skyttem. in gold.
